main_definition: A screensaver is a computer program that displays images or patterns when the screen of a computer is idle to prevent phosphor burn-in.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Computer program used for display during inactivity
meanings_and_examples.example: When I leave my laptop unused for an extended period, a screensaver of beach waves fills the screen to prevent image retention.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Visual effect or pattern displayed on computer monitors when not in use
meanings_and_examples.example: The dragonflies flying across the monitor are part of my chosen screensaver theme, which I set to activate after 15 minutes of inactivity.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Historically associated with a method to prevent phosphor burn-in on CRT monitors
meanings_and_examples.example: In the past, using screen savers was essential when working with older computer models that had a risk of image retention or 'burn-in'.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Alternative name for virtual background in video calls and conferencing software
meanings_and_examples.example: During our online meeting, we switched to the screensaver mode as an alternative to using a virtual background.
